items.title: BYD, DJI launch vehicle-mounted drone system for $2,197
items.summary:
- BYD launched the Lingyuan vehicle-mounted drone system priced at 16,000 yuan (US$2,197).
- Developed with DJI, it features a roof-mounted drone hangar with a touchscreen interface.
- The drone can take off and land at speeds up to 25 km/h and has a follow speed of 54 km/h, with a two-kilometer return range.
- The hangar recharges the drone when docked and includes a DJI drone, hangar, and compatible applications for video editing and AI services.
- The system was showcased in Shenzhen with a version of the Bao 8 SUV.
- Lingyuan is priced significantly lower than DJI’s Dock 3 starting at US$21,059.

items.title: Indian SaaS firm Zoho to launch AI models for local language
items.summary:
- Zoho is developing large language models (LLMs) focused on Indian languages in collaboration with IITs, AI4Bharat, and data collection firms like Karya.
- Challenges include mixed-language data and varying tokenization needs.
- A general LLM with 7 billion and 13 billion parameters will be released this year, while the timeline for the Indic language model is unspecified.
- Zoho is also utilizing generative AI for specialized IT applications, including anomaly detection and security algorithms, with over 80 AI algorithms implemented.
- The company processes over 5 billion API calls monthly through ManageEngine, optimizing models for accuracy and responsiveness for consumer applications.

items.title: Malaysia investigates Nvidia chip fraud linked to Singapore
items.summary:
- Malaysia to take action against companies involved in Nvidia AI chip fraud linked to Singapore.
- Singapore charged three individuals for fraud involving servers with Nvidia chips on Feb. 27.
- Malaysian authorities are probing the final destination of the chips, asserting Malaysia was not the intended recipient and ongoing investigations are in place.

items.title: Tether appoints new CFO as audit plans progress
items.summary:
- Tether appointed Simon McWilliams as the new CFO on Mar. 3.
- He replaces Giancarlo Devasini, who will become chairman.
- McWilliams has over 20 years of experience in finance, focusing on investment management and auditing.
- Tether is known for its stablecoin, which helps users avoid price volatility in cryptocurrency.
- Recent development includes a report of $13B profit for Tether in 2024.

items.title: Uber launches ride-booking pilot for teens in India
items.summary:
- Uber has launched a pilot program in India allowing teenagers aged 13 to 17 to book rides.
- The service is being tested in Delhi NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai, shifting from the previous 18+ policy.
- Parents can set up accounts for teens using Uber’s family profile feature with a debit or credit card.
- Safety features include live trip tracking and guardian notifications.
- Uber plans to expand the program to 35 more cities, including Ahmedabad, Chennai, Hyderabad, and Pune.

items.title: AWS to invest $8.2b in western India for cloud infrastructure
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) plans to invest US$8.2 billion in Maharashtra, India, announced by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.
- The investment aims to enhance AWS’s cloud infrastructure, with completion expected by 2029-2030.
- India's cloud services market is projected to grow from US$8.3 billion in 2023 to US$24.2 billion by 2028.
- AWS operates two existing data centers in India, located in Mumbai and Hyderabad, launched in 2016 and 2022.
- Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw noted the investment will include technology advancements such as graphics processing units and cloud management services.

items.title: Geely to launch smart driving system for all its car brands
items.summary:
- Geely Auto will integrate its AI-powered G-Pilot system into all vehicle brands, enhancing features like highway navigation and self-parking.
- Geely becomes the second major Chinese automaker to provide self-driving technology, following BYD.
- The initiative is part of Geely's broader strategy to advance AI integration in vehicles and improve customer experience.

items.title: US Chips Act office loses 40% of staff
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- The US Chips Act office has lost 40% of its staff, significantly impacting its operations.
- This situation raises concerns over the future effectiveness of the initiative aimed at bolstering the semiconductor industry in the US.
- Challenges include recruitment difficulties and retaining talent in a competitive job market.

items.title: Nvidia-backed AI firm CoreWeave files for $35b IPO
items.summary:
- CoreWeave, an AI infrastructure provider backed by Nvidia, has filed for a $35 billion IPO.
- The filing signifies the growing interest in AI-driven companies and their funding.
- CoreWeave aims to leverage its partnership with Nvidia to expand its offerings in AI services and computing power.

items.title: Anthropic raises $3.5b, hits $61.5b valuation
items.summary:
- Anthropic raised US$3.5 billion in a series E funding round.
- The funding led to a valuation of US$61.5 billion.
- Lightspeed Venture Partners led the round with a US$1 billion contribution.
- Other investors included General Catalyst, Jane Street, Fidelity Management & Research Company, Menlo Ventures, and Bessemer Venture Partners.
- The funds will be used for developing AI systems, increasing computing capacity, and conducting safety research.

items.title: TSMC shares drop after $100b US investment announcement
items.summary:
- TSMC shares fell by 2.25% on March 4 following a $100 billion investment announcement in the US.
- The announcement came after a meeting between TSMC CEO C.C. Wei and US President Donald Trump on March 3.
- TSMC is the world's largest contract chipmaker.

items.title: TikTok’s live feature faces lawsuit over minors’ safety
items.summary:
- TikTok generated US$1.7 billion from its Live feature in Q1 2023.
- A lawsuit by DC Attorney General Brian Schwalb claims financial and sexual exploitation of minors
- Projections estimate TikTok Live could reach US$77 billion in global sales by 2027.
- The Live feature allows purchasing virtual gifts, redeemable for cash by streamers.
- TikTok states they have implemented measures like screen time limits and age restrictions for livestreams.
- TikTok did not comment on the financial details of the lawsuit.

items.title: GM names first chief AI officer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- On March 3, General Motors (GM) announced Barak Turovsky as its first chief AI officer.
- Turovsky, aged 49, previously an AI leader at Cisco and Google, will be part of GM’s software and services engineering team.
- His focus will be on enhancing GM’s AI capabilities, including integrating AI software into vehicles and improving operational efficiency.

items.title: Nvidia, Broadcom test Intel’s 18A chip process, sources say
items.summary:
- Nvidia and Broadcom are testing Intel's 18A chipmaking process to assess manufacturing capabilities.
- Results may determine contracts crucial to Intel's struggling foundry business.
- The 18A process targets high-end chips for AI and competes with TSMC, focusing on component compatibility in current tests.
- Intel delayed the 18A process for clients to mid-2026 due to qualification issues.
- Broadcom had previous technical problems with Intel’s foundry, while AMD is exploring the process without confirmation.
- Intel aims to ramp up production by late 2025 but expects major foundry revenue growth only by 2027.

items.title: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian joins TikTok US bid
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Alexis Ohanian joins Frank McCourt's effort to acquire TikTok's US operations as a strategic adviser.
- McCourt's initiative, called 'Project Liberty,' focuses on user control over data and privacy concerns.
- The US government has given ByteDance a 75-day deadline to divest TikTok's US operations due to national security concerns.
- Other potential bidders include YouTube star MrBeast and businessman Reid Rasner.
- ByteDance has not set clear valuation terms or secured a banker, and may consider shutting down operations instead of selling.

items.title: Xiaomi to expand EV sales globally after SU7 Ultra success
items.summary:
- Xiaomi plans to sell electric vehicles (EVs) outside of China within the next few years, announced by company president William Lu at MWC on Mar. 2.
- The SU7 Ultra, a premium EV, launched in late February with a price of 529,000 yuan (US$72,627) and sold over 15,000 units in the first 24 hours.
- Xiaomi entered the EV market in 2021, and the SU7 model has sold over 100,000 units since its launch, but all sales currently are exclusive to China.

items.title: Xpeng maintains over 30k EV deliveries for a fourth month
items.summary:
- Xpeng delivered 30,453 cars in February 2025, surpassing 30,000 units for four consecutive months.
- Over 15,000 deliveries were of the lower-priced Mona model; it has consistently exceeded 15,000 deliveries since December.
- The P7+ electric sedan achieved over 30,000 deliveries within three months of its November launch.
- Xiaomi recorded over 20,000 EV deliveries in February, marking a five-month continue.
- BYD leads the industry with 318,233 new energy vehicle sales, while Li Auto, Nio, and Aito faced declines.
- Aito reported its lowest figures in a year, with 21,517 units.
- Zeekr’s deliveries increased to 14,039 units from 11,942 in January.

items.title: Right back at you: AI vs. AI in cybersecurity
items.summary:
- AI presents both advantages and threats in cybersecurity, automating attackers' abilities to launch sophisticated attacks.
- Attackers leverage AI tools to create variants of malware, evade detection, and enhance phishing efforts.
- Cybersecurity firms utilize AI for threat detection, generating synthetic data for training, and analyzing incident reports to improve response strategies.
- The future indicates an escalation in AI-driven cyber warfare, with potential for AI agents to autonomously conduct reconnaissance, probing, and execution of attacks, while defenders also advance their capabilities with similar technology.

items.title: Grab acquires Malaysian supermarket chain
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Inc is acquiring Eastern Grocer Sdn Bhd, operator of Everrise supermarkets.
- The transaction details were not disclosed.
- Navis Capital invested in the company in 2019, focusing on premium grocery retail with 19 outlets in East Malaysia.
- This acquisition follows Grab’s majority stake acquisition in Jaya Grocer two years ago.
- The deal aims to enhance digital grocery shopping advancements in East Malaysia.

items.title: The VC playbook for preventing another eFishery scandal
items.summary:
- The eFishery scandal has highlighted governance failures in Southeast Asia’s startup ecosystem, leading to calls for stronger oversight.
- eFishery, once a celebrated success, faces financial unsustainability due to fraud allegations, resulting in significant investor losses.
- VCs are encouraged to conduct deeper due diligence, ensuring that tech works and market sizes are real, and distinguishing between genuine traction and inflated metrics.
- Annual financial audits are insufficient; businesses need investigative audits to verify revenue legitimacy and uncover fraud risks.
- There is a need for more whistleblowers to report inconsistencies and fraud within startups.

items.title: Catcha Digital to expand M&A, may surpass 2024 figure
items.author: Eric Tan Leong Yit
items.summary:
- Catcha Digital Bhd is expanding its M&A strategy, aiming to surpass 80 million ringgit (US$17.9 million) by September 2024.
- Focus on platform and add-on acquisitions to enhance digital media and advertising operations.
- CEO Eric Tan emphasized strengthening online-to-offline digital media solutions.
- Recent integration of digital out-of-home ecosystem with advertisers and exploring in-person marketing.
- In December 2024, completed acquisitions totaled 35.18 million ringgit (US$7.9 million), including 60% stake in Drive 2 Digital and 51% stake in Nexible Solutions.

items.title: SG probes Nvidia chip export violations involving Dell, Super Micro
items.summary:
- Singapore is investigating possible export violations involving Nvidia chips in servers from Dell and Super Micro sent to Malaysia.
- Law Minister K Shanmugam announced the probe after arrests for misleading suppliers about the servers' end-users.
- The investigation may reveal if the servers were rerouted to other countries after leaving Malaysia.
- Singapore is seeking additional information from Malaysia and the U.S. regarding the hardware's final destination.
- Preliminary findings suggest the servers may contain Nvidia chips under U.S. export restrictions, pending confirmation.
- Representatives from Dell, Super Micro, and Nvidia have not commented on the case.
- The investigation is based on an anonymous tip, not influenced by foreign governments or U.S. directives.

items.title: Angkas vs Grab in the PH
items.summary:
- Angkas is a motorcycle taxi app in the Philippines, founded in 2016, facing challenges but returning after being shut down thrice.
- Intense competition from Move It and JoyRide, with Grab's acquisition of Move It disrupting the motorcycle taxi market.
- Regulatory uncertainty continues to hinder the sector's growth, prompting Angkas to seek geographical expansion for new growth avenues.

items.title: Fitness tech firm Aviron launches gamified treadmill
items.summary:
- Aviron, a fitness tech company based in Toronto, has launched the Victory treadmill.
- The treadmill features interactive gaming elements to enhance workout experiences.
- Priced at US$2,499, it includes a 22-inch touchscreen.
- Users can access virtual games, scenic routes, and streaming services such as Netflix, Hulu, and Spotify.
- The gaming experience adapts to workout parameters like walking/running speed and incline, with joystick-like controllers for adjustments.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm Skybox files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Skybox Security's Israeli subsidiary filed for court proceedings in Tel Aviv due to financial difficulties.
- The company has left employees unpaid with debts including unpaid salaries for February estimated at US$2.78 million.
- Previously employed around 100 people in Israel, now awaiting court's decision on liquidation or rehabilitation.
- The firm laid off its Israeli workforce and ceased operations due to financial strain.

items.title: Zomato, Paytm featured in new Indian stock exchange index
items.summary:
- The National Stock Exchange (NSE) launched the Nifty India Internet & E-commerce Index on Feb. 28.
- The index tracks 21 companies including Zomato, Paytm, Swiggy, and IndiaMART InterMESH.
- Zomato, PB Fintech, and Info Edge contribute over 56% of the index’s weight, based on free-float market capitalization, capped at 20%.
- The index is rebalanced quarterly and reconstituted semi-annually, serving as a benchmark for fund portfolios and ETFs, with a base value of 1,000 set on Oct. 1, 2021.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article discusses Indonesian firms likely to have global impact based on their funding raised.
- It lists 50 startups and tech companies from Indonesia that have received the most investor funding in the last two years.
- Funding data is sourced from Tech in Asia and is intended to be a constantly updated list.

items.title: Ola Electric to cut over 1,000 jobs
items.summary:
- Ola Electric is laying off over 1,000 employees to address rising losses and enhance operational efficiency.
- The layoffs affect teams in procurement, fulfillment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure.
- This follows a previous layoff in November 2024, which resulted in around 500 dismissals.
- An Ola spokesperson stated that the company is restructuring and automating operations to reduce costs.
- Recent developments include shutting down warehouses and a significant drop in shares due to widening net losses.

items.title: India’s GaragePlug acquires review management platform Freshreview
items.summary:
- GaragePlug has acquired Freshreview, an AI-based reputation management platform.
- The acquisition aims to enhance online reputation management for automotive service centers.
- Freshreview’s team will integrate into GaragePlug’s engineering and product divisions.
- The merger will allow for real-time sentiment analysis and streamline operations on a single platform.

items.title: Swiggy shares hit all-time low of $3.63
Unicommerce hits record low, down 59.6% from 52-week high
items.summary:
- Unicommerce shares fell 9.13% in early trading on Mar. 3, hitting an all-time low of 97.00 rupee (US$1.11).
- The stock was down 36.11% in the past month and 52.43% over six months, down 59.56% from its 52-week high of 264 rupee (US$3.02) in August 2024.
- Despite falling stock prices, Unicommerce reported Q3 FY25 net profit rising 62.1% YoY to 6.29 crore rupee (US$719.884), and revenue from customer contracts increased 26% to 32.74 crore rupee (US$3.75 million).

items.title: Honasa’s stock falls 6% despite growth efforts
items.summary:
- Honasa's stock price dropped by 6% following its recent growth initiatives.
- Despite efforts to enhance revenue and market position, the decline indicates potential investor concern.
- The financial performance remains under scrutiny as the company navigates industry challenges.

items.title: UK self-driving tech startup Wayve opens German hub
items.summary:
- Wayve, a British self-driving technology startup, has launched a new testing and development hub in Germany.
- The hub will utilize a fleet of test vehicles to improve features like lane change assistance.
- Founded in 2017, Wayve focuses on 'Embodied AI' to learn from human behavior.
- The company aims to expand into European markets from its German location.
- Germany is recognized as the largest automotive market in Europe, providing significant opportunities.
- Wayve's technology is utilized across six vehicle platforms, including electric cars like the Jaguar I-PACE and Ford Mustang Mach-E.
- The startup has secured major investments, including a US$1 billion funding round led by SoftBank Group in May 2024 and additional funding from Uber in August 2024.
- Challenges remain for autonomous driving technology, especially in mimicking human risk assessment and prediction abilities.

items.title: Israeli startups raise $550m in Feb, quantum firm leads
items.summary:
- Israeli startups raised over **$550 million** across **13 deals** in February 2025.
- This marks an **85% increase** from **$293 million** in February 2024.
- The largest deal was **$170 million** from **Quantum Machines**, bringing its valuation to **$700 million**.
- Other significant deals include **$75 million** for **Augury** and **$50 million** for **Blockaid**.
- Smaller rounds included **$7 million** for **Vayu** and **$10 million** for **Sawmills**.
- The surge reflects strong investor interest in sectors like **AI, quantum computing, agriculture,** and **cybersecurity**.

items.title: Indian VC firm raises $11.45m to support early-stage startups
items.author: Aviral Bhatnagar
items.summary:
- A Junior VC (AJVC) has closed its first fund, raising 100 crore rupees (US$11.45 million).
- Plans to raise an additional 50 crore rupees (US$5.7 million) via a greenshoe option.
- AJVC was launched in August 2024 by former Venture Highway executive Aviral Bhatnagar.
- The firm aims to provide more pre-seed funding in India’s evolving startup ecosystem.
- AJVC has invested in nine pre-seed stage startups, currently in stealth mode.

items.title: Endowus appoints chief investment officer, other hires in HK
items.summary:
- Endowus strengthens its presence in Hong Kong with leadership changes and new hires.
- Hugh Chung appointed as chief investment officer to oversee investment operations between Hong Kong and Singapore.
- Samuel Rhee becomes group chief investment officer, focusing on overall investment strategy.
- Janet Hung appointed as head of client advisory; Jasmine Chan joins as investment advisory director.
- Endowus plans to double its Hong Kong workforce and expand investment solutions in response to growing institutional demand.

items.title: Finland-based Nokia supplier launches kid-safe smartphone
items.author: HMD Global
items.summary:
- HMD Global launched the Fusion X1 smartphone designed for children.
- The smartphone allows parents to control online activities and limit access during school or bedtime.
- Available in May for a price between US$250 and US$300.
- Features include trusted contacts, restricted social media access, location tracking, and alerts for designated safe area boundaries.
- This launch positions HMD Global in the child-focused smartphone market, competing with brands like Pinwheel and Gabb.

items.title: Byju’s CEO claims misconduct as firm replaces management
items.author: Byju Raveendran
items.summary:
- Byju Raveendran alleges misconduct in ongoing insolvency proceedings of Byju’s.
- He claims evidence of "criminal collusion" between EY India, lenders, and IRP Pankaj Srivastava.
- National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) replaced Srivastava with Shailendra Ajmera from EY India as the new resolution professional.

items.title: India’s Together Fund targets $150m for AI startups by 2025
items.author: Manav Garg
items.summary:
- Together Fund aims to finalize its US$150 million Fund II by June 2025.
- Focuses on early-stage investments in SaaS and AI startups.
- Plans to support 19 to 20 AI startups with the new fund.
- Has made a total of 31 investments across both funds since inception.
- Notable investments include Jhana, RapidClaims, WorkHack, Zipstack, and UiFlow.

items.title: AI boom guzzles Malaysia’s water
items.author: Elyssa
items.summary:
- Malaysia is facing potential energy security and water supply risks due to the boom in AI data centers.
- The country hosts over 50 data centers that consume significant amounts of water and energy.
- Experts emphasize the need for Malaysia to find sustainable sources of clean water and energy for both the data center industry and its population.

items.title: 50 Rising Startups in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article lists startups in Indonesia that are on the rise, identified by their recent funding rounds.
- It utilizes data from Tech in Asia to compile a list of companies up to the Series E funding stage.
- Each listing includes key details about their funding rounds, aimed at highlighting potential future successes in the tech industry.

items.title: Grab Malaysia expands investment in Sarawak
items.summary:
- Grab Malaysia has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Sarawak Digital Economy Corporation Berhad (SDEC) to enhance digital transformation in Sarawak.
- The partnership aims to boost tourism and support local businesses by improving digital accessibility and economic opportunities.
- The collaboration will promote Sarawak as a significant tourism destination in Southeast Asia through Grab’s platform.
- Traditional merchants will receive support to digitalize operations, increasing their customer reach and income.
- The agreement also focuses on enhancing sustainable tourism by increasing electric vehicle (EV) usage for transport in the state.

items.title: Baidu to raise $1.4b from offshore yuan bonds
items.summary:
- Baidu Inc is set to issue offshore bonds totaling approximately 10 billion yuan (US$1.4 billion).
- This is Baidu's first bond issuance since 2021, including a five-year note with yields of 2.6% to 2.8% and a ten-year note yielding 2.8% to 3.0%.
- The bond size has increased from an initial 4 billion yuan (US$550 million), with pricing expected to be finalized on Mar. 5, ahead of a 4.3 billion yuan (US$600 million) debt repayment.
- The financing aligns with China’s AI boom as Baidu invests heavily in AI development.

items.title: Alibaba-backed Chinese AI firm Zhipu secures $140m funding
items.summary:
- Zhipu, a Chinese AI startup, secured over 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) in its latest funding round.
- The funding was led by government-backed entities in Hangzhou, with participation from existing investors like Alibaba and Tencent.
- This investment highlights the growing focus on China's AI sector.

items.title: Bubble tea chain Mixue shares jump 30% in HK IPO debut
items.summary:
- Mixue Group's shares surged nearly 30% on their Hong Kong Stock Exchange debut on March 3.
- The IPO raised US$444 million, pricing shares at HK$202.5 (US$26.04) each, with trading starting at HK$262 (US$33.68).
- The offering received record interest, with retail investors applying for HK$1.8 trillion (US$231.4 billion) in margin loans to purchase stock.
- This IPO is among the most highly subscribed in Hong Kong, second only to Bloks Group's offering in January.
- The performance surpassed the 0.8% increase in Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index.

items.title: Saudi deeptech firm Intelmatix launches AI Academy
items.summary:
- Intelmatix, a Saudi deeptech firm, has launched an AI Academy.
- The academy aims to boost AI literacy and skills in the region.
- Intelmatix focuses on artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.

items.title: Crypto trading platform user profits $7m before Trump pump
items.summary:
- A trader on Hyperliquid made a $7 million profit in 24 hours using leveraged trading before a Trump announcement.
- The trader invested $5.6 million in USDC for 50x leverage long positions on bitcoin and ether, with a total position worth over $200 million.
- Trump announced a crypto strategic reserve at 10 am on Mar. 2, leading to a price surge: bitcoin rose nearly 9% and cardano surged by 58%.

items.title: Coinbase CEO supports bitcoin for US crypto reserve
items.author: Brian Armstrong
items.summary:
- Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong suggests Bitcoin could be the best choice for a US cryptocurrency reserve after Trump's proposal for a "Crypto Strategic Reserve."
- Armstrong described a bitcoin-only reserve as the simplest approach and compared it to gold, while also considering a market cap-weighted index of multiple cryptocurrencies as an alternative.
- President Trump plans to include Bitcoin and Ethereum in the reserve, with potential expansions to Solana, XRP, and Cardano.
- The announcement resulted in significant market rallies: Bitcoin rose over 8% and Ethereum increased by 11%, with even larger gains for Solana, XRP, and Cardano.

items.title: UK investigates TikTok, Reddit, Imgur over children’s privacy
items.summary:
- The ICO has launched an investigation into TikTok, Reddit, and Imgur regarding children’s privacy and data management.
- The probe focuses on user data management for individuals aged 13 to 17 and assesses age verification practices.
- TikTok's data usage for content recommendation is under scrutiny, while Reddit and Imgur are examined for their age verification techniques.
- Findings will be presented to the companies if violations are found before a final decision is made.
- This investigation aligns with UK laws mandating social media platforms to protect children through effective age-checking systems.
- Companies have not yet responded to requests for comment.

items.title: Google develops digital agriculture stack for India
items.summary:
- Google is creating a digital agriculture stack for Indian farmers using satellite imagery.
- The system will assign unique farm IDs, helping to map boundaries and monitor crops.
- Potential applications include subsidy distribution, farm insurance, and loans for farmers.
- Approximately 40% of India's population is employed in agriculture, highlighting its importance.
